com.pump.swing

Class LineNumberBorder

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.pump.swing.LineNumberBorder
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    javax.swing.border.Border

    public class LineNumberBorder
extends java.lang.Object
implements javax.swing.border.Border
    This combines a javax.swing.Border with a LineNumberRenderer to help paint the line numbers for a JTextComponent.

    The advantage of offering line numbers in a border is: it can float outside the viewport, so as the user scrolls horizontally the line numbers remain visible.

      • install

        public static void install(javax.swing.JScrollPane scrollPane,
                           javax.swing.JTextPane textPane)
        Add a new LineNumberBorder to a JScrollPane. Note this supplements the existing border without replacing it (using a CompoundBorder).
        Parameters:
        scrollPane - the scrollPane to modify the border of.
        textPane - the text component to map line numbers to. It is assumed (but not enforced) that this text component is in the viewport of this scrollpane.
